content: Hi there I pretty much qualify to apply for marine OCS , I just need to take the AsVAB and finish paperwork. My Q is - If I pull of the whole OCS thing - what are my chances of getting guard duty for extended periods of times out at sea? I have disdain for ocean living but have done it in the past - just hated it. Obviously marines are a dept of navy. If I ended with guard duty on a smaller vessel especially I would be ****ed.Please answer this thanks

title: Marine Core Question

content: What is the Marine core ? Try posting your question over in the Marine Corps section, sub-section: "wannabe" forum. BTW --- If you want to be an Officer you need to learn some basic spelling things. Officers are expected to know how to spell, that is one reason why they get paid more. Marines, not marines. Department of the Navy. Not dept of navy.
reply: What is the Marine core ? Try posting your question over in the Marine Corps section, sub-section: "wannabe" forum. BTW --- If you want to be an Officer you need to learn some basic spelling things. Officers are expected to know how to spell, that is one reason why they get paid more. Marines, not marines. content: What exactly does "pretty much qualify" mean? Either you qualify or you don't... and take Jonsey's advice... your attitude sucks and one thing that you should get through your skull BEFORE you join ANY branch of the military is that YOU DO NOT DECIDE WHEN/WHERE YOU GO. You do what they tell you, when they tell you. If you can't handle that, then don't join... simple isn't it! Edited to add: Oh and just so you know... you don't just "Pull off" OCS training. YOU COMPLETE IT. I'd suggest a few more years in High School so you can get over yourself before trying... My .02 of course.
reply: What exactly does "pretty much qualify" mean? Either you qualify or you don't... and take Jonsey's advice... your attitude sucks and one thing that you should get through your skull BEFORE you join ANY branch of the military is that YOU DO NOT DECIDE WHEN/WHERE YOU GO. Either you qualify or you don't... and take Jonsey's advice... your attitude sucks and one thing that you should get through your skull BEFORE you join ANY branch of the military is that YOU DO NOT DECIDE WHEN/WHERE YOU GO. My Q is - If I pull of the whole OCS thing - what are my chances of getting guard duty for extended periods of times out at sea? I have disdain for ocean living but have done it in the past - just hated it. Obviously marines are a dept of navy. If I ended with guard duty on a smaller vessel especially I would be ****ed.Please answer this thanks How can you possibly qualify for OCS in a branch of service that you can't even spell properly? Idiot!!! "When you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks into you." ~~ Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: Originally posted by sandmano4: Hi there I pretty much qualify to apply for marine OCS , I just need to take the AsVAB and finish paperwork. My Q is - If I pull of the whole OCS thing - what are my chances of getting guard duty for extended periods of times out at sea? I have disdain for ocean living but have done it in the past - just hated it. Obviously marines are a dept of navy. If I ended with guard duty on a smaller vessel especially I would be ****ed.Please answer this thanks
reply: How can you possibly qualify for OCS in a branch of service that you can't even spell properly? Idiot!!! "When you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks into you." ~~ Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Marine Core Question

content: Sandmano4; Eye surved in the Marines in tha erly 80's and az Hoffy sed, thea wil put u whar ur "skills" r needd, witch obveeusly (good for you) meens u wil knot b a "Remington Raider". If tha Marine Core won't take u, check with the Armi.....or maybe the Nayvy...... or how about the Ayr Forse. If all fails, check with the Ayr Nashinal Gard. Your frend comingo***e come on son.....Marine "Core"?....lol.
